Package controllers

Class LogInController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controllers.LogInController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class LogInController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    This class is the controller of LogInMenu.fxml. This class serves as a log-in form for the user.
    Since:
    2021-12-13

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
        This method is called when the Log-in menu opens. The method is used to create a data logging file and initiate a connection to the SQL database.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

      • onActionNeedHelpButton

        public void onActionNeedHelpButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        This method is called when the help button is clicked. The method is used to provide IT contact information to the user.
        Parameters:
        event - is not used

      • onActionLogInButton

        public void onActionLogInButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        This method is called when the "Log-In" button is clicked. This method checks the username and password combination entered by the user against the database.

        LAMBDA: This method incorporates two lambda expressions.
        AppointmentInterface apptsInFifteen returns any appointments within the next fifteen minutes. This was created using a lambda expression as the method is only required once in the program and does not to be referenced more than once within this method.
        StringInterface structuredOutput returns a structured string of the appointments returned in apptInFifteen. This was created using a lambda expression for the same reason as apptInFifteen.

        RUNTIME ERROR: If the method can't query the database or if the password or username is incorrect, an error message will appear.

        Parameters:
        event - high-level event used to set the Stage
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - required by the FXMLLoader.load() and the prepared statements
